title: Honoring Susan D.Cummings upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of distinguished service to the State of New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Susan D. Cummings upon the occasion of
her retirement after many years of distinguished service to the State of
New York

WHEREAS, This Legislative Body seeks to  acknowledge  those  individuals
whose professional lives and civic endeavors serve to enhance the nature
of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS,  Our  local  governments,  our State and our Nation have been
strengthened by generations of Americans who felt a sense  of  responsi-
bility to their community, to one another and to their families; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Susan  Cummings  upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of
distinguished service to the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, For the past 12  years,  Susan  Cummings  rendered  faithful,
conscientious and valuable public service; and
  WHEREAS,  Susan  Cummings  was elected to Ulster County Legislature in
1986 where she spent 24 loyal years of service;  during  that  time  she
chaired  numerous legislative committees including the powerful Ways and
Means Committee; and
  WHEREAS, The first woman to serve as Ways and  Means  Chair,  Majority
Leader  and  Minority  Whip,  Susan  Cummings  has led a significant and
impressive career; and
  WHEREAS, Susan Cummings joined Senator John J. Bonacic's staff in 1998
as the DO Manager for then Assemblyman Bonacic; a year later she  became
the  Ulster County Liaison for now Senator Bonacic; she remained in that
position until her retirement in 2010; and
  WHEREAS; The proud recipient of a multitude of awards  and  accolades,
Susan  D.  Cummings  was  given  the Ulster County Trappers Appreciation
Award, the Camp Emunah and National Committee  for  the  Furtherance  of
Jewish  Education  Empowerment  Award  and the Federated Sportsmans Club
Appreciation Award as well as the Girl Scouts Heart of the Hudson Ulster
County Pearl Award; and
  WHEREAS, Susan Cummings was an honoree for  the  prestigious  YWCA  of
Ulster County Tribute to Women Award; and
  WHEREAS, A devoted member of the Ellenville Regional Hospital Auxilia-
ry, Susan Cummings, also currently serves as Chapter Chair and Executive
Board Member of RSVP of Ulster County; and
  WHEREAS,  In  her  capacity  as  Ulster  County  Community Liaison for
Senator John Bonacic, Susan Cummings  served  with  loyalty,  honor  and
distinction; and
  WHEREAS,  With  her  throughout have been her loving husband John, and
their wonderful daughter, the pride of their lives, Jennifer Lynn,  both
of  whom  feel  privileged  to  be  part  of her life and rejoice in her
achievements; and
  WHEREAS, The quality and character of life in  this  Nation,  and  the
great  State of New York, is reflective of the purposeful lives and good
works of those patriotic and civic-minded community members who dedicate
their lives and careers to the service of others; and
  WHEREAS, In her official acts, Susan Cummings was governed by  a  keen
sense of duty and always showed a unique grasp of human problems; and
  WHEREAS,  During  her tenure with Senator John Bonacic, Susan Cummings
earned the admiration, esteem and  affection  of  her  colleagues;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Susan D. Cummings upon the occasion of  her  retirement  after  12

years  of  distinguished  service  to  the  State of New York; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Susan D. Cummings.
actClause: LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Susan D. Cummings upon the occasion of her retirement after many years of distinguished service to the State of New York
